page.title: 07Ecton Copper Mines
page.content:
Ecton copper mines were owned by the Duke of Devonshire. In the seventeenth century these mines were the first in the country to use gunpowder. In the eighteenth century they were the deepest mines in the country eventually reaching a depth of 170 fathoms (about 1020 feet). These mines were also the first in the Peak District to use wagons for conveying ore. Another method of transport underground was to use boats on a river, 200 feet below the River Manifold. The ore was taken away on the Manifold Light Railway.
Part of the mine is now used to grow mushrooms.
Today, some people are involved in preparing a study centre based on the mines at Ecton Castle.
